Title: Connexins in the heart
Abstract: © 2014, Springer-Verlag Berlin Heidelberg.Connexins are essential in the propagation of electrical activity throughout the heart and are an important determinant of conduction velocity. Their dysfunction is an important factor in the genesis of abnormal cardiac rhythm and is relevant to the pathogenesis of a wide variety of cardiac pathologies. Here, we review the basic biology of connexins in the heart but particularly focus on their abnormal function in cardiac disease.
